response.content:
{
  "step1": "Gather ingredients: 2½ cups flour, 2 cups sugar, ¾ cup cocoa, 2 tsp baking powder, 1½ tsp baking soda, 1 tsp salt, 1 cup buttermilk, ½ cup oil, 2 eggs, 2 tsp vanilla, 1 cup hot water; preheat oven to 350°F and grease two 9‑inch pans for even baking today.",
  "step2": "In a large bowl whisk together flour, sugar, cocoa, baking powder, baking soda, and salt until uniformly combined; in another bowl beat buttermilk, oil, eggs, and vanilla until smooth, then gradually pour the wet mixture into the dry, stirring gently before adding the hot water to create a thin batter.",
  "step3": "Divide the batter evenly between the prepared pans, smoothing the tops with a spatula; place them on the middle rack of the preheated oven and bake for 30‑35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center emerges clean, then allow cakes to cool in pans for ten minutes still.",
  "step4": "While cakes cool, prepare chocolate ganache frosting: melt 1 cup heavy cream with 8 ounces chopped dark chocolate over low heat, stirring until silky; whisk in 2 tablespoons softened butter and a pinch of salt, then let the mixture cool to a spreadable consistency for the final layer on top.",
  "step5": "Place one cake layer on a serving plate, spread half of the ganache evenly over its surface, then top with the second layer; using the remaining frosting, coat the top and sides of the cake, smoothing with an offset spatula for a polished finish and serve immediately to enjoy today.",
  "step6": "Slice the chocolate cake into eight generous portions, garnish each slice with a dusting of cocoa powder or fresh berries if desired, and present on dessert plates; enjoy the rich, moist crumb and silky ganache with a glass of cold milk or coffee for a perfect treat anytime anywhere today."
}
